name: market for waste wood, post-consumer | waste wood, post-consumer | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23361/documentation

This is a market activity, representing a treatment mix. In the case of products needing treatment, market mixes are supplied by the activities treating the product in the geography defined by the market, and they supply the activities needing to treat the product, as they have generated it as a by-product in the Undefined processes (present as a negative input in system models). Transport to the treating facility or losses are also accounted in this type of markets, when relevant.;This is the market for  'waste wood, post-consumer', in the geography of Europe.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.

The activity starts with the input from the treatment processes.

A market for a material for treatment (wastes or recyclables) ends with the provision of treatment, i.e. a mix of treatment providers, to activities that generate the reference product as a waste/by-product.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Annual road freight transport, by type of goods and type of transport (1 000 t, Mio Tkm), from 2008 onwards (road_go_ta_tg)' (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category 'GT14 - Secondary raw materials; municipal wastes and other wastes' in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 67 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 95.1% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 64 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Railway transport - goods transported, by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (1 000 t, million tkm) (rail_go_grpgood)' (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category 'GT14 - Secondary raw materials; municipal wastes and other wastes' in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 213 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 3.4% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2016 was 7 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
